opendial.bn.distribs.discrete

Class ConditionalCategoricalTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.bn.distribs.other.ConditionalDistribution<CategoricalTable>
      • opendial.bn.distribs.discrete.ConditionalCategoricalTable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DiscreteDistribution, ProbDistribution

    public class ConditionalCategoricalTable
extends ConditionalDistribution<CategoricalTable>
implements DiscreteDistribution
    Traditional probability distribution represented as a discrete probability table. The table expresses a generic distribution of type P(X1, ..., Xn | Y1, ..., Yn), where X1, ..., Xn is called the "head" part of the distribution, and Y1, ..., Yn the conditional part.

    Technically, the table is expressed as a double mapping, where each assignment for Y1, ..., Yn is mapped to a table where the assignments for X1...Xn are associated with a given probability value. If the distribution contains no conditional part, the assignment for Y1...Yn is empty.

    Version:
    $Date:: 2014-01-21 00:18:30 #$
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

      • addRow

        public void addRow(Assignment condition,
          Assignment head,
          double prob)
        Adds a new row to the probability table, given the conditional assignment, the head assignment and the probability value. If the table already contains a probability, it is erased.
        Parameters:
        condition - the conditional assignment for Y1...Yn
        head - the head assignment for X1...Xn
        prob - the associated probability

      • incrementRow

        public void incrementRow(Assignment head,
                double prob)
        Increments the probability specified in the table for the given head assignment. If none exists, simply assign the probability.
        Parameters:
        head - the head assignment
        prob - the probability increment

      • incrementRow

        Parameters:

        head - the head assignment
        prob - the probability increment

             Assignment head)
        Removes a row from the table, given the condition and the head assignments.
        Parameters:
        condition - conditional assignment
        head - head assignment

      • fillConditionalHoles

        public void fillConditionalHoles()
        Fill the "conditional holes" of the distribution -- that is, the possible conditional assignments Y1,..., Yn that are not associated with any distribution P(X1,...,Xn | Y1,...,Yn) in the table. The method create a default assignment X1=None,... Xn=None with probability 1.0 for these cases.

      • getProb

        public double getProb(Assignment condition,
             Assignment head)
        Returns the probability P(head|condition), if any is specified. Else, returns 0.0f.
        Specified by:
        getProb in interface DiscreteDistribution
        Overrides:
        getProb in class ConditionalDistribution<CategoricalTable>
        Parameters:
        condition - the conditional assignment
        head - the head assignment
        Returns:
        the associated probability, if one exists.

      • getProb

        public double getProb(Assignment head)
        Returns the probability P(head). If the specified distribution contains conditional variables, they are marginalised.
        Parameters:
        head - the head assignment
        Returns:
        the associated probability, if one exists.

      • getFlatTable

        public java.util.Map<Assignment,java.lang.Double> getFlatTable()
        Returns a flat table mapping complete variable assignments (for both the conditional and the head variables) to a probability value.

        This flat table corresponds to the "factor matrix" structure used in e.g. variable elimination.

        Returns:
        the flattened probability table
